content:
• Tuesday, May 22, 2018
  • CTRP

    Ctrip.com +2% as double-digit revenue gains spur Q1 beat

    • Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) is up 2% in after-hours trading following the release of Q1 earnings where it beat on top and bottom lines and increased margins.
    • Operating income jumped 58% to 590M yuan; non-GAAP operating income rose 7.8% to 966M yuan.
    • A boost in interest income helped spur net income to jump to 1.04B yuan from a year-ago 44M yuan; comprehensive income attributable to Ctrip.com International was 1.459B yuan, up from 1.203B.
    • Revenue breakout: Accommodation reservation, 2.49B yuan (about $397M, up 22.9% in renminbi terms); Transportation ticketing, 2.89B yuan (about $460M, up 0.5%); Packaged tour, 834M yuan (about $133M, up 17.6%); Corporate travel, 180M yuan (about $29M, up 25%); Others, 377M yuan (about $60M, up 10.2%).
    • For Q2, it's guiding for continued net revenue growth of 12-17% (adjusting year-ago revenue for the new recognition standard).
    • Conference call to come at 8 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • IRDM

    Iridium executes sixth successful NEXT satellite launch

    • Iridium Communications (NASDAQ:IRDM) has wrapped its sixth successful launch of its NEXT satellites.
    • SpaceX launched five of the next-gen satellites from Vandenberg Air Force Base in a "rideshare" launch along with the twin spacecraft for a joint NASA/German gravity/climate experiment.
    • Iridium confirmed successful communication with all five satellites.
    • The launch brings the NEXT total in orbit to 55, leaving two more launches of 10 satellites each to wrap the $3B program.
    • Shares rose 6.8% today after Iridium's network gained maritime safety approval.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • GDS

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (05/22/2018)

    • Top gainers: GDS +8.3%. REN +4.3%. HK +3.3%. TUSK +3.3%. LPI +2.9%.
    • Top Losers: RRGB -14.9%. TCS -12.9%.  FWP -5.6%. SRG -3.7%. EOCC-OLD -2.5%.

  • HEAR

    Turtle Beach files for $30.7M common stock offering

    • Turtle Beach (NASDAQ:HEAR) files for 1.86M common stock offering by selling shareholders.
    • Offering has a maximum offering price per security of $16.53 for a maximum offering price of $30.7M.
    • Turtle Beach shares are up 0.4% aftermarket to $15.37. 
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 13 Comments
  • ARCO

    Arcos Dorados +4.7% on $60M buyback announcement

    • Top global McDonald's franchisee Arcos Dorados (NYSE:ARCO) is up 4.7% after hours in NYSE trading after announcing a $60M share repurchase program.
    • The program has a one-year duration, expiring May 22, 2019.
    • It reflects "confidence in the health and long-term outlook of the company," says CEO Sergio Alonso. “We are committed to delivering shareholder value, and with a strong balance sheet, and operating cash to sufficiently fund both our previously announced dividend resumption and investment programs, we believe we can buy back our shares while maintaining the flexibility to continue to execute on our strategic investment in the future.”
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • INTU

    Intuit -0.4% on Q3 beats, mixed Q4 guidance

    • Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) drops 0.4% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 15% Y/Y revenue growth. Mixed Q4 guidance has revenue of $940M to $960M (consensus: $890.98M) and EPS of $0.22 to $0.24 (consensus: $0.29).
    • Upside FY18 guidance has revenue of $5.915B to $5.935B (consensus: $5.79B) with EPS of $5.51 to $5.53 (consensus: $5.43). 
    • Key metrics: Consumer Group revenue growth, 15%; TurboTax growth, 4% for season; Small Business and Self-Employed Group revenue growth, 16%; QuickBooks Online subscribers, 3.2M (+45%); Self-Employed QuickBooks Online subscribers, 683K (+323K). 
    • Staff change: Dan Wemikoff, GM of the Consumer Group, will step down at the end of FY18. Senior VP of Marketing Greg Johnson will step into the vacated position.  
    • Earnings call began at 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast/replay available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Intuit beats by $0.22, beats on revenue (May 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • RRGB

    Red Robin -11% after Q1 miss, light Q2 profit guidance

    • Red Robin Gourmet Burgers (NASDAQ:RRGB) has slid 11.1% in after-hours trading following a miss on top and bottom lines in its Q1 earnings along with light profit guidance for the current quarter.
    • Revenues ticked up just 0.2%, lower than Street forecasts, and net income fell to $4.4M from a year-ago $11.6M; adjusted net income was $9.1M.
    • Comparable restaurant revenue fell 0.9% Y/Y driven by a 1% decrease in average guest check against a 0.1% increase in guest count. The guest check drop was made of a 2% drop in menu mix offset by a 1% gain in pricing.
    • “While our sales were disappointing in the first quarter, we continued to do much better than casual dining on traffic according to Black Box Intelligence, outpacing the sector by 230 basis points," says CEO Denny Marie Post, pointing to off-premise sales gains.
    • For Q2, it's forecasting EPS of $0.55-$0.75, on the low side of expectations for $0.75.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • PFNX

    Pfenex readies stock offering

    • Pfenex (NYSEMKT:PFNX) initiates a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • HPE

    Hewlett Packard Enterprise reports Q2 beats, 10% rev. growth, upside FY guide

    • Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE:HPE) reports Q2 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 10% Y/Y revenue growth. In-line Q3 guidance has EPS from $0.35 to $0.39 (consensus: $0.36). Upside FY18 guidance has EPS from $1.40 to $1.50 (consensus: $1.41; was: $1.35 to $1.45).
    • Segment results: Hybrid IT revenue, $6B (+7% Y/Y); Intelligent Edge, $710M (+17%); Financial Services, $916M (+5%). 
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP operating margin, 8.6% (+2.7 pts Y/Y); cash flow from operations, $0.2B (-$0.5B). 
    • Press release. 
    • HPE shares are up 0.8% aftermarket to $17.54.    
    • Previously: Hewlett Packard Enterprise beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (May 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters boosts profits by multiple on record Q1 sales

    • After an initial jump, Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) has turned 2.2% lower after fiscal Q1 EPS jumped by nearly four times and easily cleared expectations.
    • That's due in part to record Q1 sales and "healthy" margin improvement, as well as SG&A leverage and a lower tax rate. Gross margin came in at 32.8% vs. 32.6% expected, and up from a year-ago 31.5%.
    • Net income was $41M vs. a year-ago $11.9M.
    • Gross profit was up driven mainly by lower markdowns at its three brnads and leverage in store occupancy cost (due to growth in Retail comparable net sales).
    • Net sales by brand: Urban Outfitters, $322.7M (up 13.3%); Anthropologie Group, $347.1M (up 11.6%); Free People, $181.3M (up 13.7%); Food and Beverage, $4.6M (down 20.9%).
    • Net sales by segment: Retail, $775.6M (up 12.3%); Wholesale, $80.1M (up 13.1%).
    • Inventory rose by $45.1M (up 12.6%); comparable retail segment inventory was up 8% at cost.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 13 Comments
  • HPE

    Hewlett Packard Enterprise beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE:HPE): Q2 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $7.47B (+9.9% Y/Y) beats by $90M.
    • Shares +1.5%.

  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan spikes as Rio Tinto said ready to accept Grasberg deal

    • Freeport McMoRan (FCX +3.3%) spikes as much as 6.5% following a report that Rio Tinto (RIO -0.4%) is ready to accept a $3.5B deal with Indonesia's government for its interest in the Grasberg copper and gold mine.
    • State-owned Inalum plans to acquire Rio’s joint venture interest in the operation under a wider arrangement aimed at taking control of FCX’s local unit, according to the report.
    • Talks on Grasberg have dragged on for more than a year as FCX has sought to agree to terms to cede majority ownership, part of a deal that would allow the company to keep operating in Indonesia.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 20 Comments

  • Money pours into leveraged long Brazil ETF

    • According to Bloomberg, traders poured $53M into the Direxion Daily Brazil Bull 3x Shares ETF (NYSEARCA:BRZU) yesterday. This came as the fund hit its lowest level in nearly one year.
    • They're being rewarded today - it's higher by 8.15%.
    • The popular iShares MSCI Brazil Capped ETF (NYSEARCA:EWZ) is up 2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • AEL

    American Equity up nearly 8% on sale chatter

    • According to Reuters, there's buyer interest in American Equity Investment (AEL +7.9%).
    • Update: Athene (NYSE:ATH) and Fidelity & Guaranty are reportedly among those sniffing around.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • WFT

    Weatherford may sell a larger business to help trim debt, CEO says

    • Weatherford (WFT -3.2%) may have to sell one of its larger businesses next year to pay down its sizeable debt, CEO Mark McCollum says.
    • McCollum, who has been restructuring operations and selling assets to reduce WFT’s $7.8B debt, does not identify which businesses the company might sell.
    • WFT expects to close on the sale of four smaller assets this year, bringing in a combined $500M, is selling its land rig business, and has “multiple options” for that unit, McCollum says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Counterpoint: Apple's Q1 iPhone shipments +16% in U.S.

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhone shipments in the U.S. grew 16% Y/Y in Q1, according to Counterpoint data.
    • Shipments totaled 16M iPhones and the strong showing gave Apple a U.S. market share of 42%. 
    • Samsung (OTC:SSNNF, OTC:SSNLF) came in second with a 22% share with shipments down 4% Y/Y. 
    • Super-premium phones costing more than $800 accounted for 20% of Apple’s Q1 sales and 8% of Samsung’s sales.   
    • Previously: Nomura Instinet reiterates Apple at 6% downside on iPhone X, Services revenue (May 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 43 Comments
  • SNAP

    Report: Snap loses monetization chief to Tesla

    • Stuart Bowers, VP of Monetization at Snap (SNAP +0.3%), is leaving to work on autopilot software for Tesla (TSLA -3.1%), Cheddar reports.
    • He'll become VP of engineering at the automaker, sources told Alex Heath, and Snap confirmed that Bowers' last day at Snap will be Friday: “He has long had a dream to pursue his passion for robotics and we wish him the best."
    • Bowers is the latest in a string of execs to leave Snap since last year's IPO -- nearly a dozen in senior leadership.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 113 Comments

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3.00 PM (05/22/2018)

  • RTN

    Raytheon, defense sector lower after Credit Suisse downgrade

    • Raytheon (RTN -2.7%) is lower after Credit Suisse downgrades shares to Neutral from Outperform with a $219 price target, trimmed from $250, as part of a wider downgrade of the defense sector whose stock gains the firm thinks have topped out.
    • While RTN has a number of solid opportunities in front of it, including the new Long Range Stand-off Weapon and hypersonics, the current share price largely reflects this upside, says Credit Suisse analyst Robert Spingarn.
    • "After six consecutive years of relative outperformance, defense hardware stocks have reached valuation multiples not seen since 2001," Spingarn writes. "But whereas in 2001 those multiples were deserved in light of the beginning of a major land war and the end of an industry consolidation wave, today's market appears to have gotten ahead of itself."
    • Along with the RTN downgrade, Spingarn cuts price targets for Northrop Grumman (NOC -2.3%), General Dynamics (GD -0.6%), Lockheed Martin (LMT -2%), Harris (HRS -2.2%), Huntington Ingalls (HII -1.1%) and L-3 Technologies (LLL -1.1%).
    • Spingarn reiterates Outperform ratings on HRS, HII and LLL, saying they "trade at reasonable valuations with clear program visibility and international exposure."
    • ETFs: ITA, XAR, PPA
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 19 Comments
  • BGC

    General Cable slumps 4% on report of government probe

    • According to Capital Forum, the Justice Department is investigating General Cable (BGC -3.9%) for FCPA violations.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • EGO

    Greece minister pledges to resolve Eldorado standoff over metallurgy plant

    • Eldorado Gold (EGO +14.7%) soars after Greece's energy minister says the government aims to resolve the long standoff with the miner over its development plans in the coming weeks.
    • EGO received a favorable ruling from arbitrators last month on its planned metallurgy plant in Greece but said it was still awaiting some permits for the project.
    • The ministry does not specify what such an agreement would entail but says the ruling meant that Greece had to make sure that EGO would produce pure gold, silver and zinc in the country.
    • EGO halted investment and suspended operations at its Skouries project last November, citing years of permit delays.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 12 Comments
  • DQ

    Daqo New Energy +6% as Morgan Stanley buys 5% stake

    • Daqo New Energy (DQ +5.9%) jumps within $1 of its 52-week high after Morgan Stanley discloses that it now holds a 5.1% stake in the company.
    • According to an SEC filing yesterday, Stanley owns 16.4M ordinary DQ shares, equivalent to 656K of the U.S.-traded American depositary shares, making it the Chinese company's fourth-largest shareholder; it held just 19,000 ADSs at the end of Q1.
    • DQ has gained 10% YTD through Monday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • LOW

    Not your typical earnings report coming from Lowe's

    • There's an increased level of interest about Lowe's (LOW -1.1%) Q1 earnings report tomorrow after the retailer made one of the most interesting CEO hires of 2018 when it named current J.C. Penney chief Marvin Ellison to the position. At least one investment firm thinks it could be indication that the quarterly numbers are a disappointment.
    • Q1 estimates on Lowe's have already been revised lower after a soft quarter was reported by Home Depot due to weather and slow tax refunds, with Q1 revenue of $17.5B off comparable sales growth of 2.2% (Lowe's guided for 3%) expected. Anything below a 1.2% comp would be below the average 300 bps spread over the last two years between Lowe's and Home Depot's comparables. On the bottom line, Q1 EPS of $1.22 is anticipated to be reported. Full-year guidance will on the radar of investors. Analysts expect Lowe's to guide for revenue of $71.3B and EPS of $5.45 for the fiscal year.
    • New CEO Marvin Ellison won't be on the earnings conference call.
    • Previously: Lowe's nabs J.C. Penney's Ellison for CEO spot (May 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • SDR

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (05/22/2018)

    • Losers: LGCYP -14%. TGA -12%. QES -11%. LGCY -10%. EGY -10%.

  • KTOV

    Kitov down 13% ahead of FDA action date on KIT-302

    • Thinly traded nano cap Kitov Pharma (KTOV -13.4%) slumps on triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 474K shares. No particular news accounts for the action.
    • Thursday, May 30, is the FDA's action date for the company's marketing application seeking approval for KIT-302 for the treatment osteoarthritis pain and hypertension.
    • Previously: Kitov files U.S. marketing application for lead candidate KIT-302; shares ahead 8% premarket (Oct. 2, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 9 Comments
  • JHX

    James Hardie up 4% post Q4 results

    • James Hardie (JHX +4.1%) reported Q4 revenue of $525.9M (+6.4% Y/Y) reflecting higher net sales price and volume in North America.
    • Q4 Adj. diluted EPS increased by 50% Y/Y to $0.18.
    • North America fiber cement segment: Net sales +6% Y/Y to $410.1M, sales volume +1% Y/Y to 586.8 mmsf, average sale price +5% Y/Y to $629 per msf and EBIT +36% Y/Y to $103.4M.
    • International fiber cement segment: Net sales +9% Y/Y to $112.5M, sales volume +2% Y/Y to 128.9 mmsf, average sales price +2% Y/Y to $773 per msf and EBIT +10% Y/Y to $26M.
    • Q4 Overall margins: Gross improved by 380 bps to 36.3%, Adj. operating improved by 438 bps to 15.4% and Adj. EBIT improved by 400 bps to 19.6%.
    • FY19 Outlook: Company expects new construction starts between 1.2 - 1.3M; North America fiber segment EBIT margin between 20-25% and Capex ~$350M
    • Previously: James Hardie reports Q4 results (May 21)
    • Transcript
    • Slides
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • FWP

    Forward Pharma up 35%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Forward Pharma A/S (FWP +34.5%) jumps on more than double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 228K shares. No particular news accounts for the action.
    • A couple of weeks ago, it filed an appeal of a decision by the European Patent Office revoking its EP2801355 patent related to dimethyl fumarate, the active ingredient in Biogen's MS med Tecfidera.
    • The appeal process could take as long as three years so Forward's Tecfidera royalties should be safe until then.
    • Previously: Forward Pharma loses challenge to European patent covering dimethyl fumarate, Tecfidera royalties at risk, appeal planned; shares down 14% (Jan. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Financial sector the winner today

    • It's a flat day for the major averages, but the financial sector (XLF +1.1%) is making a sizable move the upside.
    • No doubt helping is the fast progress being made in Congress on reform of onerous post-crisis-era banking regulations.
    • Bank of America (BAC +1.6%), Goldman Sachs (GS +1%), JPMorgan (JPM +1.8%), Citigroup (C +1.5%), PNC Financial (PNC +1.7%), Regions Financial (RF +2%), MetLife (MET +1.1%)
    • ETFs: XLF, FAS, FAZ, VFH, UYG, FNCL, IYF, BTO, IYG, RYF, FXO, SEF, FINU, RWW, FINZ, JHMF, FAZZ, FNCF
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 26 Comments
  • TIF

    Tiffany earnings preview

    • Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) is down 1.40% ahead of tomorrow's earnings report.
    • The company is expected to post revenue of $959M in Q1 off of same-store sales growth of 2.6%. Same-store sales are seen growing at over 3% for the Asia-Pacific, Americas and Japan regions to help offset weakness in Europe.
    • Analysts expect Tiffany to report EPS of $0.84 off a gross margin rate of 62.1%.
    • Investment firms such as Consumer Edge and Oppenheimer with Buy-equivalent ratings on Tiffany expect the stock to be a second-half story.
    • Shares of Tiffany are down 2% YTD.
    • Sources: MarketWatch, Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • CNET

    ChinaNet Online +3.1% as Q1 net loss narrows

    • ChinaNet Online (NASDAQ:CNET) is up 3.1% after double-digit revenue gains in it Q1 results led to a narrower net loss.
    • Revenues rose 13.7% overall, and revenues from search engine marketing and data services rose 29.6% to $6.4M as the company rapidly expanded its client base.
    • Gross profit was $0.6M, down from a year-ago $1.3M, chiefly due to increased investment in resources for lead generation and sponsored search.
    • Net loss narrowed to $0.6M from a year-ago loss of $1.1M.
    • The company had cash and equivalents of $7.5M, vs. $3M as of De.c 31; advances from customers were $2M, vs. $3.6M at the end of Q4.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Brazil truck drivers on strike over fuel prices, putting Petrobras in a bind

    • Truck drivers in Brazil are on strike for a second day against a sharp rise in fuel prices, blocking highways and urban traffic in a country that relies heavily on road transportation.
    • The Abcam national truckers association says 200K of Brazil’s nearly 1M self-employed truck drivers are demanding that Petrobras (PBR -2.3%) stop letting rising international oil prices trickle through to the pump.
    • The state-controlled company says it will cut diesel prices 1.54% and gasoline prices 2.08% starting tomorrow, but fuel prices have surged nearly 50% at Brazilian refineries in less than a year.
    • Brazil's government forced PBR to keep pump prices stable and bear the brunt of higher costs when oil prices hit $100/bbl in 2012-14, sending the company’s debt load past $100B in 2016; PBR has since been permitted to adjust its sale price according to global markets, helping reduce its debt to ~$77B this year.
    • Any return to government interference to resolve the situation "would be very negative,” says analyst Rafael Passos at the Guide Investimentos asset management firm.
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BZQ, UBR, DBBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 15 Comments
  • TSRO

    Tesaro up 8% on takeover chatter

    • The takeover rumor du jour is TESARO (TSRO +8.3%), up on double normal volume. The company recently upped its 2018 sales guidance for PARP inhibitor Zejula to as much as $345M.
    • PARP competitor Clovis Oncology (CLVS +3.1%) is up as well.
    • Previously: Tesaro Q1 Zejula sales $48.9M; sales outlook raised; shares down 1% premarket on revenue miss (May 4)

  • TYEKF

    Thyssenkrupp jumps as Elliott reportedly set to take stake

    • Thyssenkrupp (OTCPK:TYEKF) surges 9.5% in German trade following a report that activist investor Elliott Management is close to taking a stake in the company.
    • Elliott is said to prefer a replacement for CEO Heinrich Hiesinger, who has faced criticism from shareholders for being too slow to move the company away from its steelmaking roots and sharpen its focus on industrial goods such as elevators and car parts.
    • Swedish investment firm Cevian, Thyssenkrupp’s second largest shareholder with ~18%, has been the most vocal critic of Hiesinger’s strategy, saying the company needs a more radical shakeup.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • MDXG

    MiMedx perks up 12%

    • Embattled MiMedx (OTC:MDXG +12.4%) is up on average volume as early-bird investors take positions hoping for a positive outcome from the investigation into its sales and marketing activities.
    • The stock also reportedly received a mention by Value Investors Club.
    • Previously: MiMedx comments on indictment of former speakers (May 10)
    • Previously: MiMedx reiterates confidence in performance, sees no material effect from investigation (Feb. 23)

  • T

    Goldman Sachs: Hedge funds betting against Nvidia, Intel

    • Goldman Sachs lists the stocks hedge funds are short selling the most in the “Hedge Fund Trend Monitor” report. 
    • Top 10: AT&T (T +0.5%), Intel (INTC +0.3%), Walmart (WMT -0.8%), Nvidia (NVDA -1.3%), CVS Health (CVS +0.6%), Walt Disney (DIS +0.1%), Target (TGT -1.6%), Chevron (CVX +0.5%), Johnson & Johnson (JNJ -0.7%), and Pfizer (PFE +0.3%).
    • See the dollar amount of the short interest for each company at CNBC.

  • ZTCOF

    Opticals moving again as Trump now says no deal yet to save ZTE

    • More hitches in optical component stocks as President Trump now says there's not yet a deal with China to save ZTE (OTCPK:ZTCOF).
    • Trump contradicted this morning's Wall Street Journal report suggesting the deal outlines were set, including financial penalties for ZTE and required management changes.
    • ZTE had ceased major business operations after receiving a seven-year ban on buying components and software from U.S. companies.
    • Up as much as 2.8%, Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) has trimmed gains a bit to 1.8%. Up as much as 4.9% today, Acacia Communications (NASDAQ:ACIA) is now up just 0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 7 Comments
  • CDAY

    Ceridian HCM Holding down 3.2% post Q1 results

    • Ceridian HCM Holding (CDAY -3.2%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 11.7% Y/Y to $208.9M.
    • Cloud revenue of $125.2M (+38.0% Y/Y) & Total HCM revenue, which includes revenue from both Cloud & Bureau solutions was $187.2M (+11.8% Y/Y).
    • Q1 overall margins: Total operating increased 612 bps to 12.6%; HCM operating margin was 14.6% & HCM Adj. EBITDA increased 470 bps to 23.3%.
    • 3,154 Dayforce customers were live on the Dayforce platform for Q1, an increase of 674 customers Y/Y.
    • Cash & equivalents were $62.2M (-37.6% Q/Q); Cash flow from operating activities for Q1 was -$23.3M.
    • Q2 Outlook: Cloud revenue of $123-125M; Total HCM revenue of $173-175M & HCM Adj. EBITDA of $27-29M.
    • 2018 Outlook: Cloud revenue of $521-524M; Total HCM revenue of $730-735M & HCM Adj. EBITDA of $148-152M.
    • Previously: Ceridian HCM Holding reports Q1 results (May 22)

  • AMZN

    ACLU: Amazon facial rec tech used by police poses a "threat"

    • The ACLU of Northern California obtains documents about Amazon’s (NASDAQ:AMZN) facial recognition project Rekognition.
    • Police in Orlando, Florida and Washington County in Oregon currently use Rekognition to use its real-time facial recognition system on police body camera footage and municipal surveillance systems. 
    • Key quote from the ACLU, airing concerns: “By automating mass surveillance, facial recognition systems like Rekognition threaten this freedom, posing a particular threat to communities already unjustly targeted in the current political climate. People should be free to walk down the street without being watched by the government.” 
    • The ACLU and other groups want Amazon to stop providing Rekognition to law enforcement and government agencies. Rekognition, part of the AWS cloud, also serves enterprise clients like Pinterest and C-SPAN for object recognition and analytics. 
    • Amazon shares are down 0.3% to $1,581.10.

  • IRDM

    Iridium +5.5% as network gets approval for maritime safety

    • Iridium (NASDAQ:IRDM) is up 5.5% premarket after news that its network has won approval for maritime safety, a move that will let it compete in a global ocean market.
    • The International Maritime Organization's Maritime Safety Committee made the determination, a move that Iridium says ends a decades-long satellite industry monopoly.
    • The company's services will get going with a Public Services Agreement between Iridium and the International Mobile Satellite Organization, which will monitor the company's implementation.
    • Iridium had formally begun the process in April 2013.
    • “This is a historic moment for the maritime industry and an honor for Iridium to be the second ever recognized provider for GMDSS services,” said Iridium's Bryan Hartin. “This is the dawn of a new era for mariner safety."
